top_categories.workout_context: 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge’s three-state challenge, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
3 State 3 Mountain Challenge rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge. Make this intensity feel like home.
3 State 3 Mountain Challenge’s 6,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
3 State 3 Mountain Challenge’s three-state mountain gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
3 State 3 Mountain Challenge’s three-state mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge’s 6,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on three-state mountain gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at 3 State 3 Mountain Challenge requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on three-state mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: three-state challenge, mountain gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 65 miles of three-state mountain gravel in Mentone, Alabama.
